item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

mopman_sucks:

do you really have to allocate an array like that?

I did some research and most critics disliked that you cant pass arrays as a parameter. heres a quote from wiki
" Common criticism towards Game Maker is its odd typing system, where variables can only be strings or real numbers, yet also be indexed like arrays. There is no way to make a variable hold an array, the name of the array implicitly accesses the zeroth element. As such, there is no way to pass an array as a script argument, except by passing a string holding the name of the array, which is then used to access the array itself. The other data structures are not very well integrated into the language, requiring a type unsafe index handle to the data structure, and requiring explicit deallocation (which has the potential for memory leaks). As well, they are only available to registered users."

For example if you have gmLibary you can use C++ header files, or if you use MaxWinApi2 you can make windows applications. Also there are some really advanced Games/Programs you can make with GML.

item.title: What do you guys think of GML (GameMaker Language)?
item.dc:creator: @n-Gen n-Gen
item.description:
@n-Gen wrote:

Hey everybody, mine name is Brian and I am new here by the way :), well the Language I program with the most is GML (btw GML is an Interpreter Language not a Programming Language), and I want to get your opinions on it? Do you like it or no? Do you believe it is powerful or weak? Just stuff like that. Also I use MANY extensions like: MaxWinAPI2, High Time Resolution, CMD, DB, gmLibary, and etc…

For everyone who does not know GML here is a script to make a simple server:

/* ==================== */
/*       -START-        */
/* ==================== */
/* Starting the server. */
/* ==================== */

//Start everytihng
dllinit(0,true,true);
script_initlines();

//Create the player list. We fill the array with -1's. -1 means a free space. The array has 200 spaces
//so that means that only 200 players can join. The maximum number that you can change this to is 255.
for(i=0; i < 200; i+=1)
    {
        global.players[i] = -1;
    }

//Open the TCP socket which listens for new connections
servertcp = tcplisten(43594,10,1);

//Check to see if it opened properly...
if (servertcp)
    {
        //If it did we tell the player
        script_addline("HOST: TCP socket opened on port "+string(servertcp)+'.',c_green);
        
        // Castle Wars building health
        global.saradomin_structure = 1000000;
        global.guthix_structure = 1000000;
        global.zamorak_structure = 1000000;
        
        // Castle Wars building health
        global.saradomin = 1000;
        global.guthix = 1000;
        global.zamorak = 1000;
        
        global.player_array_size = 0;
        
    }
    else
    {
        //If it didn't, we close the socket, tell the player and end the game
        closesocket(servertcp);
        wd_message_simple("Unable to start the server.");
        game_end();
        exit;
    }
    
/* ==================== */
/*        -END-         */
/* ==================== */
/* Starting the server. */
/* ==================== */
